alert.note: Alert for Death Valley National Park (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 29 at 10:17AM PST until December 30 at 4:00PM PST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THURSDAY ABOVE 4500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow above 4500 feet. Total snow accumulations of up to 12 inches in the Panamint. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Death Valley National Park. * WHEN...Until 4 PM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. This includes Towne Pass along Highway 190 between Stovepipe Wells Village and Panamint Springs. Also, higher elevations of Dantes View Road.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions will make travel very hazardous or impossible. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
